title.en: Check species names in biodiversity data from separate sources

description.en: This process XYZ HERE PLEASE, from the sources GBIF, iNaturalist and VertNet, with data provided by the user or other sources. For more details, please ask BOKU.

species_names_list.title: Occurrence data (list of species)
species_names_list.description: List of species. Optional. Instead, you can provide a CSV table of species ('species_names_url')

species_names_url.title: Occurrence data (CSV table / URL)
species_names_url.description: URL to a table containing the occurrences from any source. This can be the outcome of the match-data process. Optional. Instead, you can provide a list of species ('species_names_list').

colname_species.title: Column name: Species
colname_species.description: Column name that indicate the Species in the provided dataset. Only required you provide tabular occurrence data ('input_data'). Example: "species"

percent_correctness.title: pct number
percent_correctness.description: The percentage that indicates the errorness for the species to be accepted for it to be replaced with the database name. Mostly fish species names are qualitt controlled.

bool_merge.title: Add checked names on dataset
bool_merge.description: If a dataframe with species names is provided and merge is true, then all columns are returned. For only one species, the merge will be set automatically to false.

bool_ecosystem_type.title: Output ecosytem types
bool_ecosystem_type.description: Return ecoystem checks for species from FishBase including marine, freshwater, and brackish.

bool_rm_duplicates.title: Remove duplicates
bool_rm_duplicates.description: Remove duplicates from the dataset. Default is FALSE.

cleannames_df.title: Dataframe with checked or quality controlled species data.
cleannames_df.description: A table containing a column speciescheck with names checked with databases for consistency. For fish species, FishBase is used as a standard database.
